org.guicebox.failover
Interface Heart

All Known Implementing Classes:
NonBlockingHeart
public interface Heart

Sends and receives heartbeats to advertise this node's presence and detect the presence of other nodes in the cluster.

Author:
willhains

Method Summary
 void beat()
          Begins sending heartbeats, starting immediately and followed once every HeartbeatInterval milliseconds.
 void listen(HeartbeatListener heartbeatListener)
          Starts listening for heartbeats.
 void stop()
          Permanently stops sending/receiving heartbeats.
 void stopBeating()
          Temporarily stops sending heartbeats.
 void stopListening()
          Temporarily stops listening for heartbeats.
 

Method Detail

listen

void listen(HeartbeatListener heartbeatListener)
Starts listening for heartbeats. Each time a heartbeat is received, the specified listener will get a HeartbeatListener.onHeartbeat(Heartbeat) callback. If no response is received within HeartbeatInterval x HeartbeatTolerance, the specified listener will get a HeartbeatListener.onHeartbeatTimeout() callback.

beat

void beat()
Begins sending heartbeats, starting immediately and followed once every HeartbeatInterval milliseconds.

stopListening

void stopListening()
Temporarily stops listening for heartbeats.

stopBeating

void stopBeating()
Temporarily stops sending heartbeats.

stop

void stop()
Permanently stops sending/receiving heartbeats. The Heart cannot be used to send or receive heartbeats after calling this method. This method blocks until the internal listen & beat threads are completely shut down, unless the calling thread is interrupted.
